pageDescription: Professional EML to HTML converter with MIME parsing, header extraction, attachment handling, and security sanitization. Convert emails from Outlook, Thunderbird, Apple Mail, and other clients. Features include raw view, rendered HTML view, headers table, source view, and attachment extraction. Perfect for email migration, template analysis, forensics, and archiving. Supports quoted-printable, base64 encoding, multipart messages, inline images, and all RFC822/2822 standards.

instructions.title: How to use EML to HTML Converter

steps.title: Upload or paste your EML file
steps.description: Upload an .eml file from your computer or paste the EML content directly into the input area. The tool accepts standard RFC822/2822 email format from any email client.

steps.title: Choose your view mode
steps.description: Select from Raw View (original EML), Rendered View (HTML as it appears), Headers View (structured metadata table), or Source View (extracted HTML code) to analyze different aspects of the email.

steps.title: Review extracted components
steps.description: Examine email headers (From, To, Subject, Date), view the HTML or plain text body, and access the attachments list with metadata including file names, types, and sizes.

steps.title: Export or download results
steps.description: Download the converted HTML as a standalone file, export headers as JSON for programmatic use, save attachments separately, or copy the HTML source code to clipboard.

troubleshooting: Invalid EML format: Ensure file starts with email headers and follows RFC822/2822 structure
Encoding issues: Try manual charset selection if special characters appear garbled
Missing images: Inline images with CID references are converted to data URIs, external images may not load
Large file processing: Files over 10MB may be slow - consider splitting or using batch mode
HTML not rendering: Some emails only contain plain text - check the Rendered View tab
Corrupt attachments: Base64 decoding errors indicate corrupted or non-standard encoding
JavaScript warnings: The tool automatically removes scripts for security - this is expected behavior
Slow performance: Disable preview rendering for very large HTML emails to improve speed
Browser compatibility: Use Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge for full feature support
Missing headers: Some email clients may strip headers - the tool shows all available data
